website_summaries.verdict: Combines with an app to precisely pinpoint your pet's location using both cellular and GPS technology.
pros: Works to help find lost pets as well as monitor the pet's activity during the day
Provides apps for both Apple and Android smartphones
Will send you notifications if the pet leaves a particular area
Also allows you to monitor the pet's activity for a 24-hour period
cons: Requires a monthly subscription plan, so you have some ongoing costs

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed! Wouldn't update for 1/3 of the time I had it!
customer_reviews.text: It worked for the first 2 weeks, then malfunctioned for 2 days. They blamed it on the battery being dead which it absolutely was not. Then it malfunctioned the next week, and it hasn't updated in 5 days. The cat's collar fell off in that time & now the tracker & collar are gone. If the thing actually worked & did what it was supposed to, I could find it & I wouldn't be out all that money. They said it's because there must not be cell service in that area. I live in a suburban area with many cell towers nearby. Only buy one if you live NEXT to a cell tower I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie M.

customer_reviews.title: I don't like bait and hook techniques
customer_reviews.text: Your product description says a monthly fee of 6.95 a month and it is 9.95 a month. You also insist on a 12 month commitment. I don't like bait and hook techniques. Justs be honest and transparent from the start. I just got it charged and I'm not even going to try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Holly U.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this Dog Tracker!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this product. After our skittish rescue dog got loose for 3 long and scary weeks (see first photo), we researched dog trackers. He has had the Whistle 3 for a month now and it works great. It is easy to set up and use, holds its charge for at least one week, and has a great interface. We never want to go through what we went through again, and are happy we found the Whistle 3. Peace of mind! Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: A Solution for Small Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Whistle is indeed too bulky to attach to the collar of a small dog. However, I found a solution that works great for my 7 lb. toy poodle. I sewed the base of Whistle’s collar strap onto the mesh fabric of my dog’s harness,. The Whistle collar attachment attaches securely to the collar strap base, and the Whistle tracker device plugs into that. It’s a solid fit. The tracker device is very lightweight and sits on my dog’s back, so he doesn’t even notice it’s there. If you use more than one harness, you can order an additional collar strap base and collar attachment for a modest price directly from Whistle.
customer_reviews.author: Philbey

customer_reviews.title: I'm Returning it
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is waaay to short. I'm recharging this thing every few days. I also get false notifications that my dogs have ran away when they are still home or worse yet, while the device is charging at my home! I'm definitely returning. The one time I needed to track my dog the battery was low 15% maybe (not dead) and i just received the "low batt" notification on the app however 15% battery life wasn't enough to track her. It tried to find her for 17 minutes (we are in great ATT cell area) before telling me the battery was dead.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hennessy

customer_reviews.title: The strap connecting the tracker to the collar broke within ...
customer_reviews.text: The strap connecting the tracker to the collar broke within an hour of use. The manufacturer is aware of the issue and already working on a more durable strap.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Traxler

customer_reviews.title: Forget it
customer_reviews.text: Forget it we have a Gray hound. This product doesn’t track but every three minutes and in three minutes a Gray hound can be half a mile away. Plus, doesn’t track in the WiFi zone at all. So by the time you get notification your pet is out of the WiFi plus three minutes to notify you where your pet is, you’ll alway be 6 min behind your Gray Hound never to be found. So if your pet is slow you’ll have a good change of finding her. But not a Gray Hound.
customer_reviews.author: Frank "The Man" Gruber

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Whistle 3
customer_reviews.text: This is the first or second review I have written but bc it is a bit costly, thought I should forewarn pple. I bought the device for my shepard who runs away and also a swimmer. The device stopped working after a year and whistle replaced it, the next device stopped working after a year and they will not replace it. I also faced the challenge often that it searching and could not locate my pet. The times it did locate, there is a significant delay. I can live with the last issues, nothing is perfect. But for a $100 device to last a year is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Clavin

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: The unit worked admirably for about 9 months, but rapidly began failing with ridiculous false positives, failure to send notifications that my dog had escaped, and declining batter life. I requested a replacement from Whistle. Following a kerfuffle of miscommunication, whistle tried to assign blame to my unchanged WiFi network. If you do purchase the product, I'd highly recommend taking the supplemental warranty. You may need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Raccoon

customer_reviews.title: Inadvertently caught a cheater
customer_reviews.text: I was testing out my new whistle's accuracy by putting it in my car first and then my husband's car. I wanted to make sure it worked before I put it on my cat. Surprise surprise! Didn't expect to find him cheating, and with multiple women. I kicked him to the curb and gave the whistle to my sister to use with her wandering child. Works great and the interface map is fantastic, and accurate right down to the house numbers. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This has been a good purchase. My dog is an escape artist and has gotten loose a few times before I got this. I have not needed to use it to track him but I worry much less knowing I could. It holds a charge for about a week, signals me when we take him on walks. Heck- I wish I had a whistle for my kid it works so well.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Worked on it forever and it would not setup
customer_reviews.text: Can't get it to connect. I worked on it several times and could not get it to let me set it up to where it would work. It Could not find wifi. Now I have to deal with sending it back. In case you don't know there is a $7 monthly fee for this to keep up with where your dog is at.
customer_reviews.author: Brass Honcho

customer_reviews.title: It works fine out of the box no problem getting a connected ...
customer_reviews.text: It works fine out of the box no problem getting a connected and for the first couple days it works great. However I'm sitting here in the parking lot of my local Big Box store with my dog who has a Charged whistle 3 on him after being here for an hour and it still shows that he's at home connect to Wi-Fi unfortunately there is no way to update location unless it thinks it's out of the safe Zone.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon F

customer_reviews.title: Service map not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I received the device and was excited to get it set up for our dog. She escaped a few months back and gave my wife and I quite the scare! This seemed like the perfect fit to keep her protected. Unfortunately, the device wouldn’t work. I contacted customer support and they pulled out Home address. After review, the service rep told me there was not service in our area. The service map on their website indicates differently. If you are in a low service area, I encourage you to contact Whistle before ordering to have them run your address. Glad the refund was so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: I FOUND MY DOG!!!
customer_reviews.text: I found sweets! Seriously thank you so much I would not have found him for 6 or 8 hours. Seriously, I would pay a million dollars for this product thank you thank you thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Javan Robinson

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! Poor customer service and product.
customer_reviews.text: This device worked well initially but stopped working within 6mths. I bought this device in November 2017 and it stopped working in April of 2018. The device is supposed to be under warranty for 1 yr, however the help desk personnel were not helpful at all and refused to send me a replacement or a refund. The battery life is about 36hrs, it is waterproof (not for swimming but if you get caught in the rain) and the device monitored my dog's activity and tracked him when he was out of the yard - these were all wonderful qualities if the device kept working.
customer_reviews.author: dmarie

customer_reviews.title: Device died less than 2 weeks in. How frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: Less than 2 weeks in and the battery won't charge. There was no physical damage to it. It just stopped charging. The company is shipping me a new device but it won't get here until 6 days from now or I have to pay $45 to have it sent next day. It worked fine the couple of times we needed it as my dog is an escape artist but how unreliable for it to stop working less than two weeks after delivery. Very disappointing and just as much that the company will not rush a new device out to us.
customer_reviews.author: Elias Papadopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind GPS tracker
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs that we use Whistle trackers on. We purchased after one of our dogs got out of our yard and spent 2 weeks in the wild before being found by a person miles away. Battery life is good depending on the time frame you select for updating. I set mine at 3 minutes so I have to recharge about every week. Putting it in track mode of course drains the battery more. The Whistle 3 is a big improvement over previous units. There is a pay service you must enable for the unit to work. To us, it's a low cost for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work without actual, strong 3G Service.
customer_reviews.text: Virtually worthless for instantaneous tracking if you do not have STRONG 3G service. LTE doesn't cut it. When I talked to customer service I was told it was not going to work well where I lived and, as I understood it, if you buy it from Amazon, the 90 day return did not apply. Why? It is the same price, but you get it faster without additional S&H . In my second contact with manufacturer was told, "Sorry about that." Do not buy this without the requisite 3G and do NOT go by the ATT website Whistle sends you to to verify service.
customer_reviews.author: Maine Coaster

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: So far so good and my cat doesn't notice it. I can already see he travels farther than I expected. Would like to turn on tracking or request location update even in WiFi range if I want to though because my WiFi has long range.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Subscription plans are a little ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: It's $10/month if you don't want to pay yearly. That's fine. However, it's a 12 month commitment, even if you're paying month to month, which is not clear until you've ordered the device, charged and are in the process of setting it up. I'm assuming this decision was made because people cancel? If not, it's a bad business decision (if people aren't cancelling, you're just making people angry, like me), and if that is why there's a contract in there, then the product is bad. Either way, bad experience and deal.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P. Galligan

customer_reviews.title: Piece of poo
customer_reviews.text: Battery won’t last 24 hours. Additionally, gps tracking fails in areas my cell still works. What’s the point? I’m very unhappy with this and am returning. Not sure if I am going to lose subscription payment but I will dispute. Stay away. This isn’t what it’s supposed to be. I think there is review manipulation with this product as it is clearly not worthy of the glowing reviews it’s been given.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Get this over tracactive.
customer_reviews.text: This tracker is way better than the tracactive tracker. The interfere is super easy to use. The virtual fence can be beustom shapes not just a squares. It provides cool exercise stats in your dog The battery last way longer than the tracactive. Especially if you have a good wifi network and the dog stays in it. It's slightly more money but totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Wiggles

customer_reviews.title: There's NO monthly subscription option at all
customer_reviews.text: As others have pointed out, there is NO monthly option at all--even though the ad language would lead any reasonable person to believe that. I bought this for a trip--maybe two months. I was fine paying the $75 for the unit and the $10/mo while we were traveling. It is not $10/month. It's $10/month with a twelve month commitment. So, needless to say, this piece of junk will go back to Amazon. The language both here and on Whistle site is misleading--I'd say, purposefully misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Englishboy

customer_reviews.title: How do you lose a GPS?
customer_reviews.text: Well we had the product approximately 3 weeks before it was lost. If you are buying this to track your animal don’t waste your money. Thankfully our cat came home but without collar and tracker. I thought no big deal we pay for the GPS so we can track it. Walked over to the spot and 4 of us searched the surrounding area and found nothing. It had a fully charged battery that was dead in less than 48hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa Clancy

customer_reviews.title: JUNK DONT WASTE $
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Company does not stand by it. Mine was broken within a couple months. They sent valcro to keep it on. Always tells me my fog is 1/2 mile down the road when it works & my dog is sitting in my garage or I’m charging the device in my house. Never has it worked properly. I have had it less than a year & I can’t get any $ back. Battery is dead almost daily. Don’t waste $$! Now they tell me its outdated & shouldn’t have been sold🙄🙄but amazon still sells it. JUNK
customer_reviews.author: Shonnana

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This this is worth it's weight in gold. Your dog getting out can be a huge panic. If your dog ever gets out you are alerted and you can find them on your own. Otherwise you are just waiting for the call that either someone found them or you are out searching. Sadly the dog could be in street before you find them, so time is essential. This lets you locate your pet right away. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Loyalcustomer2016

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work Without Good ATT Coverage
customer_reviews.text: I live in the country, where cell coverage is limited. My internet is fine - satellite receiver up a tree. Whistle updates every 6 minutes, but never in my app. When I called Customer Service, they could see where the dog was, but I couldn't. They said I'd be able to see where she was when she returned home to my wifi. That's right - I can see my dog's locations 'only' when she has already returned home! So, as a real-time tracker, this isn't useful at all. The product seems fine, but if you don't have good cell coverage, it won't work. Returning it, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Scott V. Young

customer_reviews.title: Battery does not last / Give false location
customer_reviews.text: Positive - when dogs actually left the location it was accurate - Negative - Battery life lasted 48- 72 hours tops . If your dogs are active . - Also has many false notifications that dogs were outside safe zone - When dogs were actually in backyard on a chain .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the track mode
customer_reviews.text: Been using Whistle on a tom that formerly was feral, really fascinating to find out the extent of his domain. It gives accurate updates on his location when he's beyond Wi-Fi range. When he's within range it just shows him as at "Home". He isn't bothered by the device on his collar as far as I can tell, he doesn't scratch at it or anything like that. The one feature I would add to this product for the next model is for it to track GPS when the pet is in range for Wi-Fi, because he likes to play hide and seek in the backyard sometimes when I just need to find him quickly.
customer_reviews.author: @GLG_AZ

customer_reviews.title: Very Unreliable Coverage
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working and didn't resume monitoring whenever we travelled into areas of low coverage. If you can't trust the device, what's the point? It doesn't track in real time so alerts will always be 3 minutes behind your dog's location - if it hasn't stopped working completely, that is. Finally, I was paying the $9.95/month rate to see if I liked the service - when I called to cancel the service I learned that if I hadn't been within the 90 day trial period, I would have been charged an early termination fee! For a pay as you go service!! What a rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: So we have this new (rescue) dog that is very well behaved, but does not always respond when called. She's getting better, but still has a way to go. In any event, it provides peace of mind to know that we can track her and see her position on a map if and when she ever slips her leash. The product is easy to set up and easy to use. Seems to be very accurate as I can see her progress when I'm at work and she is with the dog walker. The battery generally lasts about 5 days, and you can see the battery level when using the app... Cool product.
customer_reviews.author: CoRo

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but collar mounts break off easily
customer_reviews.text: Pro-The unit works great. Fast, easy set up, the App works great. I was notified instantly when my dog wandered past tbe set boundaries. Con- The collar mount prongs and tbe rubber connection between the whistle and the dogs collar broke off of both units within 6 weeks. I ended up using packing tape to secure the whistle to the collars. Great product, poor design for attaching to the collars. I recommend d the company adds slots on either side of the whistle to mount. If the whistle falls off/mount breaks it defeats the emergency purpose of the tracker - which is locating your lost pet. If the mount was engineered to last, this would be a 5+ star product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not for rural area
customer_reviews.text: This did NOT work out in a rural area, even though this was promised. Would be fine for a city pet. Had a lot of trouble trying to set it up out in the country - if you want to try that, I suggest you do the initial setup in the city, and add a second location later! I was looking for a real-time update of my dog's location. Never was able to get that. I returned it for full refund. BEWARE that you also need to call Whistle to get a separate refund for the subscription service!
customer_reviews.author: Zeni

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2, 1 Stopped Tracking After a Few Weeks
customer_reviews.text: The product seemed to work OK at first for my 2 pets I attached to, although the tracking updates took longer than I liked. I suspected poor satellite coverage where I live and Tech Support seemed to confirm that when I talked to them. I don't understand why both didn't update if that's the case, but 1 did and 1 did not. It's been < 90 days so I wil have to return both under their risk free return policy. Tech Support also alerted me that since I purchased through Amazon, I may run into difficulty returning since > 30 days, even though Whistle's policy is 90 days.
customer_reviews.author: Warpaint

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for dogs who like to run away
customer_reviews.text: loving the peace of mind that if my dog gets out I will know where she is. Unexpected side benefit - the activity tracker to know how much exercise she gets every day :)
customer_reviews.author: kl

customer_reviews.title: Get one, now! DO NOT WAIT until you need it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up after receipt. Very light weight, dog doesn't even notice it. Customer service team appears to truly care. All of the above plus, very economical. I waited too long to purchase a dog tracking system and "Lost" mine overnight. It was a harrowing, nervous, unpleasant experience. Fortunately, she was returned the next morning to my great relief. I immediately started looking for the best GPS tracker. I believe that I found it with Whistle 3. If you have a dog, go for it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vizslaman

customer_reviews.title: As advertised and better
customer_reviews.text: I researched this before i bought it. The service is between $8 - $10 depending on how you pay. I oaid for a year. The battery lasts long especially if you are mostly at home on wifi and takes only minutes to charge. I charge at night when i know she is in the house. When i walk my dogs i get texts that she is away from home and it gives me the address where she is. I look up and I'm standing at the exact address! There is a track feature which connects with the device more frequently. Best purchase i have made for the piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Lish71

customer_reviews.title: I had it for three weeks and all was fine. It held the charge for 6-7 days and ...
customer_reviews.text: I had it for three weeks and all was fine. It held the charge for 6-7 days and then two weeks ago it started to only hold charge for 1 day. Kept getting messages that the whistle was running low or out of charge every evening. Emailed Whistle 5 days ago and got an auto response saying they got my message and allow for 24-48 hours for response. It is now 5 days later and nothing back from them. Product is defective and no customer service.
customer_reviews.author: travelgirl

customer_reviews.title: Not great for cats due to the nature of its collars
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our cat in case it would escape while traveling accross the country and while settling in a new place. It worked great for a while but... our cat being a cat, he gets himself in some tight spot and now has lost his collar... and we have been unable to find it even with the GPS on it. However, this is due to the design of cat collars. So if you have a dog that shouldn’t be an issue. To be clear, this product works great to find the broad area where your animal is and call your animal to retrieve it but it is not acurate enough to find an unanimated object. Recommended for dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Voyage

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.  THERE IS NO CUSTOMER SERVICE ANYMORE.  BETTER TO BURN YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. Very slow tracking. Dog can be a mile away before you get another ping. Collar snap broke. Whistle replaced, but was without protection while I waited. Now the unit has died, completely, and won’t take a hard reset. Nice idea, but needs work on speed and reliability. My time is too valuable to be constantly interfacing with Whistle Support. Stupidly bought another, but it won’t activate because the old one is still around. Customer service doesn’t answer email, phone or Twitter. Ever. They must have been bought by some big company who doesn’t care. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Kanes

customer_reviews.title: Best. Purchase. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best thing I have ever purchased. The only thing I wish was better is it takes at least 60 seconds for the location to update. But 60 seconds of my dogs possible location is better than not knowing at all. I have a husky so he naturally never wants to listen or stay at home. He loves a good chase. Whistle has been so extremely helpful. I also wanted to note that whistle really cares about pets. During this a COVID-19 outbreak, all vets are closed (we’re in New York with the most surrounding cases). Whistle has waved the fee for online chatting with a vet. I cannot recommend this product and company enough.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fonyi

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product - get the Fi
customer_reviews.text: Crappy company and product. Get the Fi - it’s infinitely better. The product quality and performance are terrible, and I’m shocked how much $$$ they charge for it. The cellular service and pricing are way too expensive, and they lock you in like a cellphone contract. BUY THE FI
customer_reviews.author: Rpark

customer_reviews.title: Worked decently for 6 months then dies.
customer_reviews.text: The accuracy of the GPS features and the device itself are decent but the accuracy is a little off. Which is ok because no product like this is going to be perfect. I purchased the subscription for tracking so I expect some better product than this and support. The device now only lasts 1 day before dieing entirely. The battery is terrible. I definitely need a replacement. If the thing only lasts 6 months before having these issues i'd expect at least 2 replacements for the price it is at. It is not a cheap product. I expect this thing to last 3-5 years and I am getting half a year out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ownst

customer_reviews.title: Bugs! Bugs! Bugs!
customer_reviews.text: At first, this product was great! However, now it is plugging us with false location reports constantly. I have tried contacting the company and they refuse to help me in any way. I would highly suggest not purchasing this product until they get their bugs worked out.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Good product but battery life stinks
customer_reviews.text: We like the product overall, but the battery life absolutely stinks. The first couple of times the battery would last 5 days. Ever since it has lasted no longer than 4 - this last time just over 2 (charged Saturday afternoon, battery needs charged Tuesday morning). Rather disappointing as the product has been very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kremeier

customer_reviews.title: Does not work without paid subscription of $10/month
customer_reviews.text: Must have a $10/month subscription plan to work (in addition to the $100 purchase price). This more than doubles the cost of the product and the data really isn't that useful since it doesn't actually measure hear rate, sleep quality, or anything health related. Get if you think it is worth $100 up front + $100/year to track "Activity minutes" and "location data" which can be spotty. Also, battery must be charged every two days and needs a special base so count on making a space for that somewhere in your device charging station as it will require your time to manage charging the device.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt

customer_reviews.title: Over great device
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is excellent assuming you have a cell signal. The issue, and it's to be expected, is that if there's no or very poor cellular signal, the battery is going to drain quickly. As someone who's used several GPS devices for hiking, accuracy is what I'd expect from a GPS device. Form factor is great. The app is overall good, not great, hasn't given me any real issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I've had the whistle for our dog (a runner - a 'gone in 60 seconds' kind of dog. I previously had a different tracker, but it needed recharging at least once a day. The whistle last 3 days, based on it's power save mode when the dog is at home in wifi range. Alerts are programmable, as is GPS tracking resolution depending on your needs. It's a well thought out module and software solution.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Man

customer_reviews.title: Delay makes it useless. Worth testing, may have just been my area.
customer_reviews.text: Giant waste of time. What's the point if it's not real time. I know GPS systems like Garmin are the best and probably only, but for the price I tried the whistle 3. By the time the dog was gone, it didn't even alert me. And just a heads up, they say it's not real time in the FAQ, but the "independant reviews" say it is real time. They need to keep those bloggers in check.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device. Very easy to use. Main thing needed to keep device working is to charge it daily. If battery drops too low location cannot be determined. I charge mine every night and have no problems with determining location of my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Schwinger

customer_reviews.title: They will charge you with full year if you cancel early.
customer_reviews.text: After my dog passed away I cancelled my subscription, they charged me with the last 2 months. The device was wrong 80% of the time, telling me that my dog was 300 feet away while she was under my feet. Bad product and bad business.
customer_reviews.author: hunter Spiers

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work. No tech support
customer_reviews.text: I tried for three days to get this to work, all the while waiting for a reply from tech support to no avail. I deleted and reloaded the app, reset the Whistle multiple times, when it finally linked to the app after multiple attempts, it still would not register with the server again after multiple resets, reinstalls, moving to different locations to get a strong WiFi and cellular signal, all the while waiting and waiting for tech support with no response after three emails and three days. Gave up and returned it. Now the battle to cancel the service, which will be difficult since I can’t get any help.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: .Slow to respond
customer_reviews.text: I was dissatisfied with the product which requires a cell signal from At&T. The cost isn’t much about $90 , however it’s very slow in accurately identifying where your run away is located. Yesterday my k9 made a dash for it. Time is the key to getting your k9 back safely and this unit is slow in identifying where your pet is located. I would say it’s almost worthless since there is no real time tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Dofelmier

customer_reviews.title: 😒
customer_reviews.text: Updated: I'd like to see a plastic clip with a thin rubber gasket.(opinion not changed from original review. I attached a zip tie around the unit for a more secure attachment and after a day in the water and I'm glad I did. I originally used it for GPS tracking; since I've used it like a fit bit for me and the pup. Definitely used for both me and me pups activity level. Today was the first time the product did not track my pup when we went out for a walk. Very disappointed! It sure what happened, but not happy. Will do another review as promised.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The overall concept of this tracker is good and not a new idea... HOWEVER, the overall quality and construction is horrible. The collar attachment is so poorly made that it will fall off an active dog and in less than a few weeks the rubber straps begin to break apart. They expect you to purchase replacement straps from their website for $5 + another $5 or more for shipping. If I hadn't subscribed to the 1 year of service I would just throw this away and settle with my losses. Until then I have used zip ties to McGuyver the collar attachment to my dog's collar...
customer_reviews.author: Mamba

customer_reviews.title: Great Device. A couple of tweaks needed to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Device. A couple of tweaks needed to get five stars: 1) Allow app to show his travels earlier than 24 hours. Seeing where Buster went is very cool, but the track seems to be inaccessible after 24 hours, with the current iOS app. 2) Battery really lasts more like two days, not three. Otherwise, this is a fantastic little collar dongle! It’s super easy to pop on and off (to support bi-daily charging), and its really fun looking over the history. Most importantly, if he ever “ran off” Ibhave no doubt I’d be able to get within “whistle distance “ in short order (especially with the track function.)
customer_reviews.author: David D Van Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: A Safe Dog is worth a fortune
customer_reviews.text: Our Muffin has, in the past been a bounder. She's older now and less likely to do so, but we let her out into the pasture in the daytime. If the fence is compromised, she can get out, which has happened on several occasions, prior to Whistle3. Now we have confidence that we can find her quicker even if she does get out. We've always retrieved her, but it was scary to know that she was not protected and on our property. I recharge her device about every three days, so that there's no time during any day that it is inoperative. We really like the security.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Mr. R

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this product. We just purchased this 3 months ago, and it dies daily. Sends alert that our dog is 3 miles from home, so we leave work in a panic and 2 minutes later it says he’s home and our dog has no way to get out of our backyard. Plus, now the latch has broken for it to attach to his collar. Would not recommend in the slightest.
customer_reviews.author: Colton Durham

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk - device stops working after a year
customer_reviews.text: This is absolute junk and the tech support can’t do anything to help. My device is 1 year and 2 months old. I just paid the renewal subscription 2 months ago and my whistle hasn’t worked for the last 2 weeks. They are saying that I can’t get a replacement, they have no idea how to fix it, and I’m stuck with no way now to know if my deaf dog has left my house.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dumke

customer_reviews.title: Too big for a cat, and requires 12 month commitment to service plan.
customer_reviews.text: I just returned it. I wish I would have done more research. I love the idea, but not a fan of paying an eternal fee. Furthermore, you can't try it out because if you pay the monthly fee you have a 12 month commitment to the service. They do have a 90 day consumer dissatisfaction route but I don't have the patience for those. I probably would have just sucked it up and paid it if it was smaller but this device is simplty too big for even a medium size cat.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel B. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Damn Good
customer_reviews.text: I've had other trackers, and earlier versions of Whistle, but this is the best yet. I was waiting to write a review until I'd had a chance to experience the tracking abilities, and a couple of days ago I got that chance. The Whistle took me right to my dog in a very short time. Very accurate and quick response! Activity level seems accurate, it's easy to charge, and the charge is long-lasting. Also like the unobtrusive form. The tracker is easily separated, charged, and returned to the collar. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dogperson

customer_reviews.title: This product is fine at best.
customer_reviews.text: THEY MAKE YOU PAY FOR THE AT&T SERVICE ON TOP OF THE WIDGET! This product is not just $99, but is an extra $200 on top of that!! This product is good for notifying you when your pet is no longer within range of either your home wifi station or your cell phone's bluetooth, but only if there is AT&T cell service in the area. So if your pet goes missing, it will let you know they're gone, but not where they're off to. Three stars. Update: this thing dies in two and a half days every time. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ilana Broad

customer_reviews.title: First one Worked Great bought a second one and hasnt worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first whistle a few years ago and worked great till my water dog got it wet way too many times. So I bought her a new one thinking it would work just as good. I was so WRONG! Do not buy this if you actualy want to know if your dog gets out of your yard. It will not tell you at all and customer service will telll you they are having a huge bug in their system and not offer any solutions to your problem besides "im sorry for your inconvinance on this matter". I biought the product for peace of mind and that is not what this product will give to you at all.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A. Hemb

customer_reviews.title: Great Product & Superior Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Whistle 3 in June of 2018. It has been a great product. It’s definitely worth the money to know you have a back up plan for your pup. I have a Golden Retriever that I primarily leave off leash and this is perfect for my peace of mind. Recently my Whistle 3 just stopped working after my 1 year manufacturers warranty was up after I paid for another year of service. I contacted Whistle 3 about the issue and they offered to replace my Whistle at no charge! Great customer service. I’ll definitely be purchasing from Whistle in the future.
customer_reviews.author: L M

customer_reviews.title: Real Time Tracking with a Peace of Mind
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after a friend recommended it. We've had the device for about a month now and love it for the most part. We took a trip to Florida while our Husky stayed in Texas at a family member's house and we were able to keep track of her. It gave us a peace of mind to know she was safe. It does use the battery super fast, like within 48 hours of you are not connected to wifi. We would recommend to any pet owner who wants a peace of mind, knowing where their pet is when not with them.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Went to set it up today and there was no light on the charger which it is supposed to have. Right in their setup information, the company states that if there is no light coming on, contact support for a replacement. They must have many problems with the chargers not working right out of the box. So I sent their pre-written email about the orange light not coming on to the company. Waiting to see how long it takes to get back to me. Disappointed right out of the box. If the company replaces it quickly, then I will write a good review after trying one that works on my dog.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Working on an active Labrador
customer_reviews.text: I tried to avoid a product with a subscription but in the end this seemed the most reliable for an active dog. Our dogs stays home most of the time but occasionally will go on a walkabout. What I like is that you get a text signal as soon as they leave the established perimeter allowing you to intervene early before they are long gone. Have been impressed with the battery life (7days) and the waterproof aspect (our dog swims). So far so good I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Westervelt

customer_reviews.title: Keeping our hound dog safe!
customer_reviews.text: Having a redbone coonhound who follows his nose more than our calls to "come", makes this device is a lifesaver. We keep him on-leash at all times, but you never know... Whistle 3 gives me an incredible sense of security about our beloved hound. Plus, the Whistle 3 team is incredibly helpful and persistent when it comes to questions and/or problems.
customer_reviews.author: Trixie Tiger

customer_reviews.title: WHISTLE SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device and it did work at first. I relocated from California to New York and I have the same Spectrum Wifi in both states. Support at whistle cannot get it to work from a different state. I paid them for the monitoring and they didn't even reimburse me for the months they could not get it to work. I don't understand how a company cannot get their own product to work. Now i am stuck with a non working whistle and a brand new spare charger that I cannot use. This company has terrible support for their product.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Ragin

customer_reviews.title: Listen to bad reviews for once and save time and money.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life on these is terrible. You basically have to recharge every day. This does not track very well either. You have to pay for an ATT subscription for each one you buy. Just bc your phone can get a signal from ATT cell towers does not mean this will pick up the signal also. Luckily we were able to cancel the service and return the items within time and get most of our money back. Also the rubber piece that holds the tracker onto the dog collar breaks easily. Can’t track anything if the tracker goes missing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D. Buxton

customer_reviews.title: Check your 3G Network carrier first
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea but I tried for a long time to figure out why my Whistle 3 was not syncing with the Whistle service. Finally after digging through layers of their help files I learned that the Whistle 3 uses AT&T's 3G network. Since we do not have cellular service from AT&T (only Verizon) the Whistle 3 will not work. I wish somebody would have told me that before I bought. Is anybody interested in a (nearly) new Whistle 3?
customer_reviews.author: Geocouple

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pet tracker I've had and I had high hopes for it. It's been MEH. I'll get an escape notification then all the app can tell me is that it's having trouble locating my dog, usually for over an hour. We have good reception with AT&T, no dense woods or anything, and the Whistle works maybe a quarter of the time. Sometimes I feel like it's better than nothing and other times I feel like it's a huge waste of money. I'd still be using the first one I had but it ran off 2G cell networks and is no longer supported. It's a shame.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: would be a 5 except for the collar
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these right after Christmas and my dogs have already managed to rip all the cheap rubber mounts that came with the devices. The devices themselves work great but I am sure that we will be losing the trackers themselves at some point so it really doesn't matter how well they work. Contacted support and they actually send you free mounts and try to sell you their collars for 25 a piece. If you bring your dogs to dog parks or around other dogs be careful the devices are like targets the other dogs love to try to pull them off. If it wasn't for the mount i would give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: MADJ

customer_reviews.title: It’s the only unit under $100 that works!
customer_reviews.text: Forget buying other GPS units. The Whistle 3 is the only GPS activity monitor that works correctly. The app has many features including how far you have walked, how many calories my dog has burnt and the amount of time spent in activity. Only complaint I have is I get notifications through the app to my iPhone that my dog has left the house. I don’t think there needs to be notifications when the phone and the GPS are together. But, that may be something I have not figured out in the application as of yet? I highly recommend Whistle 3!
customer_reviews.author: Chile'

customer_reviews.title: Must have AT&T Service
customer_reviews.text: It does not state this in the description -- but when we called the company to troubleshoot why it wasn't working, they informed us we had to have AT&T cell service. AT&T is not in our area at all. It would have been nice to have known this in advance before, 1) we spent $90 on this plus the $90 we had to spend to activate it, and 2) we would have ordered something that worked for us!
customer_reviews.author: JML

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, but monthly fee makes the total cost exceed the performance.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the investment. Initially, I was having trouble, but it was improper setup and customer support helped me fix my problem. I would recommend this product because the customer support is good and the product works. I gave 4 stars because you have to have WiFi and I feel the monthly fee is too much money considering the limitations of the product functionality and accuracy. I recommend this because for the price it works, but after you add the monthly fee and having to have a WiFi signal for it to work I wouldn't say it is full GPS capable and could be thought of as so.
customer_reviews.author: M Pro

customer_reviews.title: Far too flimsy for use on larger or hyperactive dogs. Broke in 3 days attached to a Bernese mountain dog.
customer_reviews.text: The product is absolutely flimsy. The tracker broke off of its 'mount' to the collar after only 3 days of usage. There is no way to make the charging light turn on remotely as far as I can tell so it's lost in the grass somewhere. Do not use this for a medium to large dog, any exercise or activity can and will break the worthless bracket that places it on the collar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to purchase after reading ALL the reviews, but am very happy so far with my purchase. $10/month with AT&T ok. Setup was a breeze, and the thing has worked flawlessly for the last 2 months of using it, and monitoring it through his activity level, seems very accurate. Checking his location remotely has been no problems. I do, and have recommended this device to all my pet owner friends.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: I like the Whistle 3 Pet Tracker a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like the Whistle 3 Pet Tracker a lot. Occasionally we let our Golden Retriever roam off leash and with the Whistle 3, we are able to track which neighbors she visits and know when we might need to get in the car to fetch her. I also appreciate the exercise tracking feature. My only complaint is that the device does not track in real time - but refreshes about every 60 seconds. Hopefully their technology will advance soon. This product is worth the price and does a lot to ease our anxiety when our dogs get out of our fence.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Almost impossible to cancel subscription
customer_reviews.text: We used this device and service for 3 months while we were on a road trip. Now that we're back home we no longer want to pay for the service. Whistle makes it extremely difficult to cancel your subscription. It is a manual process, not built-in to the app. They ask for pieces of information (through email) that may no longer be available to you, essentially locking you in to pay the monthly subscription fee indefinitely. We are still paying the monthly subscription fee long after our road trip. I can only recommend Whistle if you plan on using it forever.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Country dog owners beware
customer_reviews.text: Really good support and product. Didn't work for me though. Since we live in the country our wifi range isn't strong enough to support my dog's active lifestyle. She didn't spend enough time within range of the wifi so the battery didn't last but two hours. Using cell towers drains their battery. Tried two and none worked. Company was so great at support they gave me my money back and took back the products. Super company they just need a version for the active country dog, especially since those dogs are the ones who need to be tracked the most.
customer_reviews.author: L7

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my dog safe!
customer_reviews.text: We live in the woods and although we leash our dog, sometimes a deer gets her attention and she bolts making it impossible to hang on to the leash. She always returns home after exploring, but our fear has been that she would get her collar or her leash caught and be trapped. This actually happened once but at a neighbors and their dogs alerted us. We now keep Whistle on her and always know where she is if she pulls loose. We like the app and especially the tracking feature. Well worth the money- it gives us peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: BlueRidgeAl

customer_reviews.title: got several issues but no one to ask..
customer_reviews.text: great looking box and nice pictures, but after searching for ways to contact support I see there are none just a couple of company posted questions and quick generic answers.. web site looks to be contact free.. 100.00 year cell cost plus tracker.. buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: east tn

customer_reviews.title: This is why some people love it and others hate it
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: If AT&T has strong and reliable coverage in your area, this will be a very reliable product and you should feel good about buying it. If the coverage where you live is spotty or weaker, DO NOT purchase it! You will either get no location or an inaccurate location on your pet, and the battery will run out constantly because the tracker is always “searching” for a signal and burns out. Even though they told me coverage was sufficient in my area when I purchased the tracker, I’m not getting my money back and I have to pay a cancellation fee. I’m just thankful I still have my cat. And that’s why I’m warning others.
customer_reviews.author: Jfrau70

customer_reviews.title: Connection, Cellular Provider
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for when I go camping and was told that the unit would work with the US Cellular hotspot on my phone. I purchased in April and finally tried using it in June and this really requires the AT&T network unless you have a Wi-Fi connection available. I am outside the return window and stuck with a unit I cannot use but Whistle will cancel my monthly AT&T subscription. Lucky me!
customer_reviews.author: ah

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the whistle on my HFA daughter's service dog for 4 months now and LOVE IT. Not only can I always find her, he tracks her and stays with her, but I can even make sure the dog walker is taking him out for his afternoon walk at school. The battery life is incredibly long as well. Sometimes I can go over two weeks without recharging it. In addition to a long life battery, I always get an email and text letting me know when it's time to recharge. One of my Best Buys Ever!
customer_reviews.author: kblyt

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea but too many bugs and non-existent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Lots of bugs and, unfortunately, customer support just ignores us. We found that the Whistle 3 often doesn't upload data even while on wifi or with a strong cellular connection. Every time our dog was taken out for a walk, half way through it would have an error and be useless. We really wanted this to work but with all the issues and lack of support, we just had to cancel our subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Tuckerman

customer_reviews.title: Good product for tracking dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for tracking pets. The Whistle 3 is a big improvement over earlier versions. I wish the battery life were longer -- it always seems to be run down just when I need it most. I need to remember to charge every other day to keep it topped off. But it has definitely helped my track down my wayward dogs. I also wish it would automatically track the dog when it leaves the home area so I can see where she goes. It is otherwise durable and waterproof. I have at times had trouble with the tracker syncing, but customer service has been very helpful in resolving these issues.
customer_reviews.author: David Houggy Jr

customer_reviews.title: In the end this tracker works.
customer_reviews.text: At first I had many problems with this product. Now after several months I love it. I am notified shortly after my dog leaves home and I can track fairly accurately. Accurate enough. Occasionally I get nuisance alarms but then receive an at home message within minutes. I then know it was a false alarm. The collar attachment tore with 4 weeks and Whistle replaced it immediately. They say they are working on a more durable attachment. I recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Great if you live out in the country and your dog gets out of your yard
customer_reviews.text: My dogs always travel together so I just have one Whistle. I live on 40 fenced acres but they have been jumping over the fence at least once a day and traveling. I can now track to see how far from home they are and if they are just playing on some vacant land, but sometimes they are over a half mile away and then i just get in my car and follow the tracker. When they see me, they get all excited and jump in my car. When I'm in my car, the tracker shows me where I am in relation to my dog which is a big help.
customer_reviews.author: MariLynn

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought a year ago!
customer_reviews.text: I have two goldendoodles that escape with every opportunity. I can not tell you how many times I have spent hours searching anxiously for them, worried that they would be hurt. Finally decided to buy this, but was a bit skeptical because AT&T reception is a bitch sketchy where we live. They have gotten out 4 times since we purchased this and each time, the Whistle has worked wonderfully. We have been able to locate and get them home in less than 15 minutes, knowing exactly where they were. I seldom write reviews (this may be my first, can't remember?), but this one was worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Tharp

customer_reviews.title: This is crap
customer_reviews.text: I receive the whistle with high hopes only to find it was a used one attached to another dog. They had to send me a replacement. So, the replacement worked great for a short time, and please understand I’m paying for this thing through all of this. The mechanism failed and they admitted it was their fault. So they sent another one. Except this one is attached to another dog’s info and after a significant amount of effort to contact them, they have failed to communicate why I have yet another one already attached to another dogs info. I’m pissed at this point because I’m still paying for the whistle app’s monthly fee that isn’t cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have only had one issue with this, couldn't pick ...
customer_reviews.text: Have only had one issue with this, couldn't pick up a signal multiple times but I figured out that was because my dog was sleeping under the metal feed barn. This is the coolest thing. I have been able to track my dogs' escapades (I have been switching it out every day to see who is going where), and it is so accurate that it even showed exactly on the satellite view where they were getting out (this time). Wouldn't have found this spot. Only slight drawback is you have to get the GPS app and I couldn't sign up for just a few months, had to do a year contract. Oh well. Might try it on a cat too....
customer_reviews.author: Carol J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up. Tracks well. Love the view options. Battery lasts a long time & chages quick & easily. I read the reviews & have been looking for a good tracker for awhile. 18# dog loves to roam. This is small (like an electric fence transmitter) he doesn’t even notice. Perfect! I did the 1 yr subscription to save a few $ but so far, we’ll worth the $$. Highly recommend. Only draw back; would like to be able to edit his “home base” block you set up initially. Make sure you are sure of the space before you press next.
customer_reviews.author: Keri L. Perna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best answer to finding our dog that loves to run off. She has gotten so frustrated that we find her every time, so she doesn’t even bother to leave most of the time anymore!!!! The only reason it isn’t a full 5 stars is because it has randomly pinged her up to 2 miles away when she is setting on the front porch. It’s happened a couple times in the 2 months we have had the tracker.
customer_reviews.author: NE_mel

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for nyc.
customer_reviews.text: Writing a review for an NYC user of the whistle. This does not work well at all for my purpose. I came from using podtracker, better tracking, not a good company, low battery life. The tracking on the whistle is awful. It doesn't locate my dog who is 5 ft from me. It only tracks decent when they are out in teh suburbs of long island. It gives me a notice that my dog is on the other side of the east river when rather i'm walking with her even though it shows my location correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chan

customer_reviews.title: Good, not good
customer_reviews.text: We read reviews that the rubber part eventually breaks - and it did. We bought the year long app subscription for a product that we can’t attach to our dog’s collar. The product SHOULD arrive with a back up rubber part. I’ll have to email customer support and ask for another one. Great product, but super annoying to invest in the product and the $99 subscription and not use it now for a few months : /
customer_reviews.author: Kristy from Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Requires monthly subscription to use, starting at $7.95 a month. Wish I would have read the fine print before ordering this.
customer_reviews.text: Requires monthly subscription to use, starting at $7.95 a month which needs to be spelled out clearly in the name of the product, ie: "WHISTLE 3 GPS Pet Tracker (Requires Subscription)" rather than being buried in the item description. Wish I would have read the fine print before ordering this. By the time I got around to opening this and setting it up, I had missed my return window, so there's $80 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: panthan

customer_reviews.title: NOT JUST FOR DOGS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have an indoor/outdoor kitty whom I obsess over. Not even ashamed to admit it. This little device has brought me immeasurable peace of mind. You have no idea how much I wish I'd bought a Whistle sooner. Being able to track him like this has completely eliminated a major source of anxiety in my life. Thank you Whistle from the bottom of my crazy cat lady heart. P.S. It's a little large for kitties (see pics) but it's super lightweight. If your cat doesn't mind wearing a regular collar & tags, he/she probably won't mind this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Banana

product_meta.title: Whistle GO & GO Explore - the Ultimate Health + Location Tracker for Pets
product_meta.description: Color:Grey| Style:Whistle 3Whistle 3 is a top-rated GPS location and activity tracker for your pet. The Whistle device attaches to your pet’s collar and, through an app, makes it easy to track your pet’s location, distance traveled, activity, rest, and much more. Powered by At&T & Google maps, Whistle gives you reliable and accurate nationwide tracking right from your phone.1 Snap Collar Attachment.
feature_bullets: New Whistle models available: Whistle go explore and Whistle go
Nationwide location tracking: pinpoint your pet’s location with this top-rated SMART GPS activity tracker for your pet anywhere AT&T 3g cellular service is available.
Proactive alerts: get text, app or email notifications when your pet leaves home.
Get health insights: monitor your pet’s daily activities and know how your pet measures up for their age, weight and breed.
Long battery life: lasts up to 7 days! Battery life may vary depending on your pet’s activity, Wi-Fi signal strength and pet’s time spent out of Wi-Fi.

Durable & waterproof: Built to survive every swim with your pet! Waterproof for up to 3 feet for 30 minutes. Recommended for pets 8 lbs. + and attaches to any collar or harness up to 1'' Wide. Note: the notches on the top and Bottom of the back of the device are part of manufacturing process.

Subscription & Wi-Fi required: affordable monthly or annual plans cover connection to AT&T nationwide network to track & monitor your pet. No new phone contract required. Wi-fi is also required during the Whistle setup.
Age Range Description: All Life Stages

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
